summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing GDP per capita in U.S. dollars, with a total of 11 data points.
Overall GDP per capita in U.S. dollars has decreased over the Year

GDP per capita in U.S. dollars is rapidly decreasing from 2014 to 2017, slightly increasing from 2017 to 2018, gradually decreasing from 2018 to 2020, slightly increasing from 2020 to 2022, and lastly slightly decreasing from 2022 to 2024.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2015 and 2016.
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing GDP per capita in U.S. dollars, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2014 to 2017.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is extremely decreasing which exists from 2022 to 2024.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2020 to 2022.
Likewise, the next significant trend is moderately decreasing which exists from 2018 to 2020.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2017 to 2018.
